title: Reactions to racist posts on social media in the U.S. 2017
summary: This statistic shows the results of a 2017 survey among Americans aged 16 and older regarding the Reactions they are looking for in a close posts .
This statistic only shows the top five answers to that question .
40 % of the respondents stated a close posts has to be loyal .

data.Response: Comment on/ reply to the post
Discuss the content with the poster offline (e.g. on the phone in person etc.)

gold: This statistic shows the most common reactions of online adults in the United States when encountering racist posts on social media.
During the August 2017 survey , 40 percent of respondents stated they would ignore the content , whereas 31 percent would unfollow or unfriend the poster .
